item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road Sales Reach 500k in Just One Week
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Level-5 has announced that Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road sales have reached a major milestone within the game's first week on sale.

As announced on social media, Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road has racked up 500,000 sales across all of the platforms on which it's currently available. Given that it's a niche soccer RPG, that's a pretty impressive number for the game's first seven days.

The figure puts the latest Inazuma Eleven game in some pretty illustrious company as well; it's sold the same amount as indie hits like "anxiety horror" No, I'm Not a Human and cozy RPG Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is Level-5's second major hit this year, following the release of Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time back in May.

That game managed to pick up half a million sales in its first week as well, and it went on to pass the million mark before a month had elapsed, so here's hoping that the studio's latest will achieve the same result as well.

It's certainly been a long and strange journey for Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road. The game was announced all the way back in 2016 under the name Inazuma Eleven Ares, and in the years between then and now, it was delayed numerous times, receiving a couple of name changes along the way.

This is the latest title in the long-running Inazuma Eleven series, and it follows the journey of new protagonists Destin Billows and Harper Evans, with a story taking place a quarter of a century after the events of the first game.

If you're interested in seeing where that lengthy journey ended up, you can check out Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and both Switch 2 and Switch.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
